definition: to help the dying and heal the injured
to support with the hand/to help sb up/to support oneself by holding onto something/to help

sentences.english: He notes most life-saving operations have taken place.
sentences.chinese: 他指出，大部分救死扶傷的手術已經進行完畢。

sentences.english: A physician's sacred duty is to heal the sick.
sentences.chinese: 醫生的神聖職責是救死扶傷。

sentences.english: But to be inspirational you don't have to save lives or win medals.
sentences.chinese: 但要鼓舞他人，你並不一定非要救死扶傷或贏取獎牌。

sentences.english: They make it possible for doctors to perform complicated surgery to save lives.
sentences.chinese: 它們讓醫生們爲救死扶傷而進行復雜的手術成爲可能。

sentences.english: It is universally acknowledged that it is the doctor’s duty and obligation to heal the wounded and rescue the dying.
sentences.chinese: 全世界都知道救死扶傷是醫生的天職。

sentences.english: Saving lives is what doctors should do.
sentences.chinese: 救死扶傷是醫生份內的工作。

sentences.english: No President in the field hospital to assist party together to make Tuesday.
sentences.chinese: 長孫無蓉在戰地醫院協助方神醫救死扶傷。

sentences.english: The transplanting of human organs has brought about a revolution for our medical treating.
sentences.chinese: 人體器官移植爲人類醫學救死扶傷帶來革命性的變化。

sentences.english: Heal the wounded ,rescue the dying ,practice revolutionary humanitarianism.
sentences.chinese: 救死扶傷，實行革命的人道主義。

sentences.english: In such conditions, we had two years of life-saving work.
sentences.chinese: 就在這樣的條件下，我們進行了兩年的救死扶傷工作。

definition: benevolent heart and skillful execution (idiom, from Mencius); charitable in thought and deed
virtue has its rewards (idiom); one good turn deserves another
lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
to view death as a return home/to not be afraid of dying/to face death with equanimity (idiom)
see 念念不忘[nian4 nian4 bu4 wang4]
to throw one's life in for/to haplessly give one's life for/to sacrifice oneself torturously working for another or for a group/to pour in one's utmost effort/to shed one's last ounce of strength for
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
